Legal_Issue: Unreasonable credibility assessments by Refugee Protection Division
Credibility_Assessment: Found unreasonable; focused on peripheral inconsistencies
Legal_Provision: Subsection 72(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Basis_of_Claim: Persecution due to political activities in Cameroon
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Inconsistencies in minor details (e.g., prison name, document signing)
Application_Error: Failure to consider reasonable explanations for inconsistencies
Review_Outcome: Case referred back for redetermination by a different panel
Application_Factor: Perceived lack of credibility based on minor discrepancies
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Subsection 72(1), Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Outcome_of_Review: Judicial review allowed, remitted for new hearing
Cause_of_Refusal: Doubt about truthfulness due to minor inconsistencies
Evidentiary_Issues: Focus on peripheral inconsistencies, dismissal of plausible explanations
Procedural_Fairness: Concerns over transparent and intelligible decision-making
Credibility_Issues: Significant weight given to minor inconsistencies
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to reasonableness of credibility findings
Procedural_Issue: Need for re-determination by new panel
Omission_Type: Failure to account for context and explanations in credibility analysis
